str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Probably for Latin aquila; Akulas, an Israelite.
Offspring, family, race, nation, kind. From ginomai; 'kin'.
Belonging to Pontus. From Pontos; a Pontican, i.e. Native of Pontus.
Recently, lately, newly. Adverb from prosphatos; recently.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To come, go.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Italy. Probably of foreign origin; Italia, a region of Europe.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
Diminutive of Priska; Priscilla, a Christian woman.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Of Latin origin; Claudius, the name of two Romans.
To give orders to, prescribe, arrange. From dia and tasso; to arrange thoroughly, i.e. institute, prescribe, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From chora; to place room between, i.e. Part; reflexively, to go away.
From the base of rhonnumi; strength; Roma, the capital of Italy.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
